_exec_summary.SummaryText:
Facility Name:     Country Fresh, Flint Div.
EPA ID:              1000 0010 2998

EXECUTIVE SUMMARY

Description of Facility and Regulated Substance Handled:  Country Fresh processes fluid milk.  The facility utilizes
anhydrous ammonia as a refrigerant to maintain the proper temperature of fluid milk within the facility.  Anhydrous
ammonia is an effective refrigerant that has been used for many years by most food processing facilities.  Ammonia
ia normally a gas at ambient temperatures but is handled as a gas liquified under pressure.  The refrigerant system
consists of a high-pressure receiver, evaporators, compressors, piping and valves.

Accidental Release Prevention and Emergency Response Policies:  Country Fresh is committed to promoting safety
for the plant, its employees and the surrounding area.  The facility is complying with OSHA's Process Safety
Management Standard (PMS), Title 29 Code of Federal Regulations (CFR) 1910.119, and EPA's Risk Management
Program regulations (RMP), Title 40 CFR Part 68.  The purpose of these programs is to ensure that the refrigeration
system is operating safely in order to prevent releases of ammonia from the system.  In addition, these programs
serve to develop procedures to minimize releases in the event that they do occur and to outline appropriate
emergency response steps to take in the event of a release.

Accidental Release Prevention Program and Chemical-Specific Prevention Steps:  As a part of its PSM program,
Country Fresh has established numerous programs that serve to prevent accidental releases of ammonia.  These
programs include:

- Process safety information
- Standard Operating Procedures
- Employee Training
- Mechanical Integrity
- Management of Change
- Pre-startup review
- Compliance Audits
- Incident Investigation
- Employee Participation
- Hot Works Permits
- Contractor Safety

Emergency Response Information:  As a part of the PSM Program, the facility maintains an Emergency Response
Plan that was prepared

in order to improve responsiveness to an emergency incident, and to increase the reliablity
of actions taken during an incident.  The plan includes all aspects of emergency response including adequate first aid
and medical treatment, evacuations, notification of local emergency response agencies, as well as the public.  In the
event of an emergency involving the ammonia system, it is the policy of the facility to request assistance as
necessary by calling 911, Genesee County LEPC, Police, Sheriff Department, Fire Department and Young's
Enviromental.

Five year accident history:  Country Fresh has an excellent record of preventing accidental releases over the
last 5 years.  Due to our stringent release prevention policies, there has been no accidental release during this time.

Steps to Improve Safety:  Several developments and findings have resulted from the implementation of the various
elements of our accidental release prevention program.  The most important of these are increased employee
training, preventive maintenance and timely inspections.  

In addition, the facility will continue to operate and maintain the system in accordance with IIAR Guidance and will
continue to implement its OSHA PMS Program in conjunction with the Risk Management Program.
